Package com.hippikon.security

Hippikon is a powerful authorization API that was developed for enterprise software applications and is now provided free under Version 2.1 of the GNU LGPL.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
Configurable The Configurable interface forms part of the extensibility mechanism of the authorization framework and should be implemented by fine grained objects or aggregave view helper objects where creating an empty class just to inherit ProtectedResource becomes unwieldy.
PermissionSet The PermissionSet interface represents a set of flags (or an ACL entry) for a ProtectedResource.
 

Class Summary
AuthorizationContext The AuthorizationContext provides a placeholder for information retrieved after a user of a application has been authentication.
ConfigurableProtectedResource A default implementation of a Configurable class that is also a ProtectedResource and can be used within a List passed to the PermissionsFactory.
DefaultAuthorizationContext The DefaultAuthorizationContext provides a default implementation of the AuthorizationContext interface.
DefaultObjectPolicy The DefaultObjectPolicy class provides a mechanism to handle simple authorization based on the the roles assigned to a user.
DefaultPermissionSet The DefaultPermissionSet class provides a default implementation of the PermissionSet interface using bitwise operations to manipulate permission flags.
MutablePermissionSet The MutablePermissionSet class provides an implementation of the PermissionSet interface that may be manipulated by Policy implementations.
PermissionsFactory The PermissionsFactory class provides a convenient and simple mechanism for obtaining a PermissionSet for a ProtectedResource made by a user within an AuthorizationContext.
PermsNavigator PermsNavigator provides a Swing GUI that displays an XML Policy Store defined for an application.
Policy The Policy abstract class provides a simple mechanism for specializing security logic for a ProtectedResource at runtime.
PolicyStore The PolicyStore represents a list of permissions defined for ProtectedResource objects hosted within a product.
ProtectedResource The ProtectedResource interface must be implemented by any object within an application that needs to have permissions based access enforcement that is handled by the Hippikon Authorization framework.
ProtectedResourceWrapper This class is provided as a utility to find the overridden resource name of a ProtectedResource.
 

Exception Summary
IllegalAuthorizationException Signals whether any access to a ProtectedResource is denied on the grounds that basic authorization data provided in the AuthorizationContext is either not present or invalid.
PolicyStoreLoadException Signals that the PolicyStore could not be loaded for a ProtectedResource access within a AuthorizationContext.
ResourceNotFoundException Signals that a ProtectedResource could not be located in a PolicyStore
 

Package com.hippikon.security Description

Hippikon is a powerful authorization API that was developed for enterprise software applications and is now provided free under Version 2.1 of the GNU LGPL.

Hippikon provides features not found in existing APIs, such as Sun's JAAS. It is an XML driven mechanism that allows static permission rules to be defined, and also allows object state, object hierachy, user associations, permission inheritance and permission overrides into account at runtime. The API is small, fast and simple to use. The design follows a logical domain model based on a number of standard security design patterns.
